title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a Java file is already opened in one editor and an attempt is made to open the same file in another editor, nothing happens and the file does not open in the second editor.
EB: When a Java file is already opened in one editor and an attempt is made to open the same file in another editor, a warning message should be displayed in the workbench. The warning message should inform the user that they may overwrite changes and ask if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed, stating that all files need to be closed before opening the Java file in another editor.
SR:
1. Make sure you have an associate Windows editor for your Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double-click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the Java file opened. Close it.
3. Go to the Java Perspective and open a Java file by simply double-clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench.
4. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
5. Observe that nothing happens, instead, a warning message should be displayed in the workbench informing the user about potentially overwriting changes and asking if they want to continue, or an error message should be displayed stating that all files need to be closed before opening the Java file in another editor.
